actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 94-1068.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #424 (370-41).
Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Finance, S. Rept. 94-1175.

official_title: A bill to suspend the duties on certain bicycle parts and accessories until the close of December 31, 1979.

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate, amended) Amends the Tariff Schedules of the United States to suspend temporarily the customs duties on specified bicycle parts and accessories. Suspends temporarily the customs duties on calcined petroleum coke not commercially suitable for use as a fuel. Restricts the amount of duty free liquor a foreigner may bring into the United States to one quart. Allows the National Institute for Occupational Health and Safety to acquire from the Internal Revenue Service the mailing addresses of taxpayers for purposes of medical referral or the conducting of mortality studies.

titles.title: A bill to suspend the duties on certain bicycle parts and accessories until the close of December 31, 1979.
